archetype

Die Vorlage, bei der die erste Spaltung begann, nennen wir den Archetypus. Der Text diese Archetypus ist frei von allen nach den Spaltung entstandenen Fehlern, steht also dem Original näher als der Text aller Zeugen. Gelingt es also, diesen Text sicherzustellen, so ist damit die constitutio bedeutend gefördert.

Die besondere Bedeutung derjenigen Vorlage, die wir als Archetypus bezeichnet haben, ist unbestritten, und ein anderer Name dafür steht nicht zur Verfügung. Man sollte daher nicht andere Zwischenglieder zwischen Original und erhaltenen Zeugen, so wichtig sie unter Umständen sein können, als Archetypus bezeichnen.

(missing reference) 6

contributed by elisa – last updated on 26-01-2015, by wout.

The exemplar from which the first split originated we call the archetype. The text of this archetype is free from all errors arising after the split and is therefore closer to the original than the text of any of the witnesses. If we succeed then in establishing the text of this, the constitutio (reconstruction of the original) is considerably advanced.

The special importance of the exemplar which I have termed the archetype is not contested, and there is no other name available. For this reason we should be careful not to use the term archetype of other connecting links between the original and the surviving witnesses, however important they may be at times.

(missing reference) 2-3

contributed by elisa – last updated on 26-01-2015, by wout.

L’archétype est le plus ancien témoin de la tradition où le texte d’un auteur se trouve consigné dans la forme qui nous a été transmise. S’il y a plusieurs formes de la tradition, il y a évidemment plusieurs archétypes.

(missing reference) 108-109

contributed by elisa – last updated on 26-01-2015, by wout.

The archetype (defined as the lowest common ancestor of the known manuscripts).

(missing reference) 32

contributed by elisa – last updated on 26-01-2015, by wout.

Si chiama archetipo la copia non conservata, guastata da almeno un errore di tipo congiuntivo, alla quale risale tutta la tradizione; di solito lo si designa o con x […], o con ω e a partire da esso (o, in sua assenza, dall’originale) si contano le diramazioni dello stemma.

(missing reference) 128

contributed by elisa – last updated on 26-01-2015, by wout.

Archetyp (griech. arche ‘Ursprung,’ typos ‘Geformtes’) Der älteste, aus allen Zeugen zu erschließende Überlieferungszustand eines Textes, der aber noch nicht mit dem Original identisch ist.

(missing reference) 135

contributed by wout – last updated on 26-01-2015, by wout.

Archetype. The original from which variant copies of a text have evolved. Typically it is lost and must be reconstructed from surviving witnesses.

(missing reference) 269

contributed by wout – last updated on 26-01-2015, by wout. 

                a. (archetype of specific [witnesses](witness.html)) latest common ancestor;                
                b. (archetype of a [work](work.html), or without qualification) latest common ancestor of the known witnesses; known witness when common ancestor of the rest.
(missing reference) 117

contributed by elisa – last updated on 26-01-2015, by wout.
